identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New Jersey

abstract.p: Some of tall ships participating in OpSail 2000 will also visit Atlantic City, NJ, where they will be open for free tours and crews will hold seamanship demonstrations (S)

block.p: Some of the tall ships that will sail through New York Harbor this weekend in OpSail will also visit Atlantic City. The ships will be open for free tours and the crews will hold demonstrations of different aspects of seamanship. The visits to Atlantic City are sponsored by Trump Marina and the Casino Reinvestmnent Development Authority.

The Arethusa, a 72-foot ketch with an 86-foot-tall mast out of Kent, England, and the Jolie Brise, a 60-foot cutter rig with a 77-foot-tall mast out of Southampton, England, are among the ships invited to dock at the Farley State Marina Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

Some of the tall ships that will sail through New York Harbor this weekend in OpSail will also visit Atlantic City. The ships will be open for free tours and the crews will hold demonstrations of different aspects of seamanship. The visits to Atlantic City are sponsored by Trump Marina and the Casino Reinvestmnent Development Authority.

The Arethusa, a 72-foot ketch with an 86-foot-tall mast out of Kent, England, and the Jolie Brise, a 60-foot cutter rig with a 77-foot-tall mast out of Southampton, England, are among the ships invited to dock at the Farley State Marina Wednesday, Thursday and Friday.

Also set to visit Atlantic City are the Gulliver of Southampton, scheduled to be docked at Gardner's Basin, and the Maiden, which is scheduled to be at the Farley/ Trump Marina, this week. From Sept. 22 through 24, the Californian and the Izuerda will be at the Farley/Trump Marina. Information: (609) 345-2498.
